title: Comprehensive Social Protection Coverage
description: In 2021, Bolivia achieved a remarkable social protection coverage, reaching 96.94% of its population, one of the highest globally.

title: Extensive Social Safety Net in Poorest Quintile
description: Bolivia's social safety net programs covered 99.34% of the population in the poorest quintile in 2021, showcasing a strong commitment to supporting its most vulnerable citizens.

title: High Child Labor Hours
description: In 2015, Bolivian children aged 7-14 worked an average of 23.44 hours per week, indicating a significant issue with child labor.

title: Inadequate Unemployment Benefits
description: In 2019, unemployment benefits in Bolivia accounted for only 1.20% of the total welfare of beneficiary households, one of the lowest globally.

title: Strong Social Safety Net Across Quintiles
description: By 2021, Bolivia's social safety net programs covered over 90% of the population across all income quintiles, with the richest quintile at 90.20%.
